1_1LnyrYbdxDU1K78nEYVZkfJ1Q4SYP1ukFV.body:
> [basxto](#comment_17_1PVcdu7USZH2kHMETbqDYLPjJZKCDWM52k): A spam vote is definitely needed and hiding stuff that is > 50% spamvoted and has at least 20 votes

Make it grey.
Or have other background.
Or put a red bar on one side.
Or on both sides.
(-: serial logic ;-)
...because not hiding fits a warning better.
Hiding feels so much like censorship.

> I'm against subjective downvotes, which could also be against another persons opinion â€¦ if you don't like it, skip it

Your thumb has 3 basic directions: up, "don't care", down.
Tricky... only being able to vote or not to vote, there is something missing.
And you have only 1 "down" per message.
It just takes one other reader to compensate.
I don't expect voting wars.
But if they happen, these messages will have many up- and many down-votes.
These votes should be shown indepently (and totalled) instead of just showing the result so 1000 upvotes still can be seen even if there are 1001 downvotes.

But please: Let's have the spam/phishing/warning/.../xyzzy button first.

Summary:
warning +1 (now)
downvote +1 (later)
